ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
ygData.msgSnippet: O wait! I take that back... It would DEFINATELY have a huge negative impact on the item farmers that solo certain areas for days like the suppliers room in
ygData.messageBody:
O wait! I take that back... It would DEFINATELY have a huge negative impact
on the item farmers that solo certain areas for days like the suppliers room
in Guk... They would now have to except lists, except group members or share
the spawn...

I haven't figured out if this is a good thing or really bad thing. I think
at first it might be good but I got a feeling it will quickly degenerate and
become hell itself....
----- Original Message -----
From: Jeff Illian <jeff@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 2:18 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"


> From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
>
> I initially thought this as well, but the post that I sent out earlier
> showed that Gordon was not planning on changing policy on servers like
> Prexus. On Prexus if you want into the Kings room and there is another
> group in there already, you can request to be added to that groups waiting
> list. Whenever a member of that group leaves, the next person of the
> appropriate class on the waiting list gets the call to come and join the
> hunt.
>
> Gordon seemed to me to make it clear that this was a fully acceptable way
to
> deal with the other group that wanted to camp the same spot and the
> GMs/Guides would not force the group in there to split the spawn. If this
> is truely a reality, this policy should barely touch life on Prexus
> generally every single camp there is works on the "list" principle
anyhow...
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. <dean_kimes@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 11:54 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
>
>
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> >
> > The postings made it clear its worse than that. If a room has two named
> > spawns a second group can freely waltz in and demand to be allowed to
camp
> > one of the named spawns. If its a room with two different items that
> > different classes in your group wants, suddenly part of your group has
> > nothing to gain from camping the room and will likely leave in disgust
> after
> > this happens two or three times.
> >
> > Kit
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 10:54 AM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
> >
> >
> > From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>
> >
> > Must be nice to camp multiple spawns :) On Karana each room is seperate
> > camp, has been for months.
> >
> > Rokenn
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 9:46 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
> >
> >
> > From: jhenders@...
> >
> > On Thu, Mar 16/00, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> wrote:
> > > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> > >
> > > Right, but all it takes is one of these groups who will not agree to a
> > > compromise to force an intervention by "Big Brother". They make it
> > > perfectly clear that No One will like the decision that "Big Brother"
is
> > > going to make so you better sort it out yourselves. This is just an
> > > invitation to get someone to officially irritate someone for those who
> > > desire to irritate. They know they won't like the compromise already,
> so
> > > they are perfectly willing to use the threat of forcing others to
accept
> > > "Big Brother's" unacceptable ruling to bend reasonable people to their
> > will.
> > >
> >
> > Check out this guild's use of the Play Nice policy to break the player
> > made agreement that's been in effect in Sol B on our server. They did it
> > the first day of the new policy.
> >
> > http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum38/HTML/000173.html
> >
> >
